intro: Hypochaeris variegata var. glaucescens, commonly known as the blue-eyed Mary, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring basal leaves that are often hairy and serrated. Its flowers are yellow with a blue or purple center, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits called cypsela. This species is often found in disturbed soils and is considered an invasive plant in some regions.
